results.title: A Portrait of Trinidad
results.creator_credit: W. A. Lee, Victor M. Gover and County Films Ltd
results.brief_description: Trinidad on the threshold of independence. Among her thriving industries shows oil, asphalt, ad cigarettes in production. Progress in agriculture, transport, and communications, health and education, are also described. Carnival scenes capture the charm and gaiety of the Caribbean island.

results.title: Portrait of the family
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
The Commonwealth of nations, like a world within a world, embraces a vast variety of peoples, cultures, languages, religions, and customs. This album contains self-portraits of the nine self-governing members; the united kingdom, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, the Unions of South Africa, India, Pakistan, Ceylon and Ghana. Each country is described for us, in terms if its national and geographical characteristics by a native citizen.

results.title: Port of London
results.creator_credit: Clifford Hornby, G. Buckland-Smith, Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Port of London Authority
results.brief_description: The work of the Port of London Authority, which administers the tidal waters of the Thames. Shows the handling of cargoes on the docks and the storage, sampling, and grading of a wide variety of goods, also the piloting of vessels on the river.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clifford Hornby, G. Buckland-Smith, Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Port of London Authority

results.title: Pond animals
results.brief_description: Demonstrates methods of collecting pond animals, both microscopic and macroscopic, and encourages children to study pond life for themselves. A newt, stickleback and wil-i-gig beetle are caught and then in jars to the laboratory to be examined. Other animals seen are the water scorpion, Great Pond Snail, Water Boatmen, Daphnia and others. A drop of pond water is also studied under the microscope.

results.title: Poise and movement
results.brief_description: The importance of balance and poise to prevent undue strain and unnecesary fatigue. Situations shows include nurses standing during a heavy ward round. Carrying a heavy loaded tray, lifting a heavy bag upstairs, giving bedside attentions and moving a double bed. Nurses from a London hospital demonstrates correct and incorrect ways of moving, first in uniform and then in swimsuits so that the actions of their limbs can be clearly seen.

results.title: Point Pelee, nature sanctuary
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Point Pelee National Park, southernmost tip of the Canadian mainland in Ontario, provides a hunting ground every spring for the ornithologist, entomologist, botanists- and the photographer. This seven-mile strip of forest-covered land projecting into Lake Erie services as a main way-station for migrating birds. This film shows many different species of birds found into this protected area, as well as butterflies and other insects and examples of wild-flowers and shrubs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Point of the stick
results.creator_credit: M Thompson, William Orr and Visnews Productions
results.brief_description: The overall objective is to illuminate the famed art of Sir Adrian Boult’s technique of conducting, in a fresh and personal way for each viewer. The film features Sir Adrian Boult conducting the London Philharmonic Orchestra with Moura Lympany (piano) and John Carol Case (baritone). Features the music of Beethoven, Handel, Mozart and Brahms.

results.title: The Pleasure is mutual
results.creator_credit: Joanna Foster, William D Stoneback and Connecticut Films Inc
results.brief_description: This exceptional film covers the goals of picture book programs, general planning, specific criteria for selection of good books suitable for varying age levels, methods of preparing for the session, and the techniques of group control. All aspects of the subject from broad theory to precise details about technique are covered in this filmed record of story book sessions in day care centre and libraries in the New York region.

results.title: The Playful pandas
results.brief_description: Shows some of the characteristics and behaviour of pandas through the story of two pandas, Ling Ling and Sang Siang in the National Zoo in Washington D.C. Using whimsical dialogue, the other zoo animals try to find out what makes the pandas so special.

results.title: Play better golf. Part I. Fundamentals
results.brief_description: Championship players, Lloyd Mangrum, Sam Snead, Patty Berg, and Jim Ferrier illustrate, by slow motion, sequences and close-ups, the three fundamentals of good golf - correct grip, aim and swing.
